questions.text: Which component of cement causes allergic contact dermatitis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Chromium Most common allergen is hexavalent chromium salts Allergic contact dermatitis more than irritant contact dermatitis. Level of exposure needed for allergic contact dermatitis 100–400 ng/cm². Tartrate, glycine, silicone, dapsone, ferrous sulphate causes conversion from chromium (VI) to chromium (III), which is less allergenic.
